entry.title: Beats of Stress
entry.content:
The Comprehensive Exam (or “comps”) is a notoriously stressful milestone in the PhD journey. It is a high-stakes exam that tests the student’s knowledge of their field and their ability to think critically. The format of the exam varies by departments, but usually consists of both a written and an oral component. For my doctoral program, this involved writing a research proposal laying out the plans for my dissertation research, and then defending it in front of my doctoral committee, which comprised of five faculty members from related fields.

Beat by beat, the heart tells the story of my PhD exam.

Notes: Used the Wahoo TICKR heart rate monitor to capture the data, exported using the Wahoo app, cleaned up the data and plotted the graph in R. Code for the plot available on my GitHub.
entry.summary: A physiological perspective on my PhD exams
